scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoings, even when aware of them?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: to self - justification for past mistakes

impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I obstinately refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, unwilling to admit my mistakes?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: from someone who was suffering an illness
callousness.question: Did I turn away from someone who was suffering an illness?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

extracted_data_phrases: towards someone who was suffering from an illness
despite knowing their need for companionship and comfort
callousness.question: Did I neglect to be supportive and caring towards someone who was suffering from an illness, despite knowing their need for companionship and comfort?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

blasphemy.question: Did you swear to God in a moment of frustration, anger, or impulsivity?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: in a moment of frustration , disappointment , or desperation

blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly having committed sacrilege?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, thereby profaning God's presence within me?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence the way I lead, teach, or guide others in my various roles within the community?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation of material possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' blessings and secretly wished they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: of jealousy towards others ' good fortune

envy.question: Have I secretly compared my blessings to those of others, feeling discontent because theirs seem greater?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use unbecoming language that offended others, thereby violating their dignity through my words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that were hurtful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

impiety.question: Have I worked on Sunday when otherwise it could have been avoided, thereby failing to observe the Lord's day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my relationships with others, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
